meanings.definition: Relating to the sensation of bodily movement.
meanings.sent1: The kinesthetic experience of dancing made her feel alive.
meanings.sent2: She had a kinesthetic awareness of her body's position in space.
meanings.sent3: His kinesthetic sense was so strong, he could dance in his sleep.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed through her, creating a kinesthetic symphony of movement.
meanings.sent5: The kinesthetic memory of the dance stayed with her long after the music stopped.

meanings.sent1: The kinesthetic feedback from his muscles helped him balance.
meanings.sent2: The therapist used kinesthetic techniques to improve his coordination.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her kinesthetic sense was so good, she could dance blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: His kinesthetic understanding of his body was like a finely tuned instrument.
meanings.sent5: The kinesthetic connection between mind and body was evident in his graceful movements.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the ability to feel bodily movements.
meanings.sent1: The kinesthetic child loved to run, jump, and play all day.
meanings.sent2: Her kinesthetic nature made her excel in sports and physical activities.
meanings.sent3: He had a kinesthetic sense that tingled whenever he moved.
meanings.sent4: The kinesthetic joy of movement filled his days with energy.
